gridoCSS

A simple, light and responsive 6KB FlexBox CSS Grid.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

grido container

~ add 
grido
class to your container
~ example: 
 <div class="grido"></div>

grido items

~ add 
gc_
class to your items, followed by the type of column that you're looking for based on a classic 
grid-view
.
~ types: 2, 3, 4 ... up to 12
~ special widths: 
.gc_auto
set width to auto
~ example: 
 <div class="gc_12"></div>
set 2/3 width to the item
 

grido percent items

~ add 
gc_
class to your items, followed by the 
% width
that you're looking for + 
-p
.
~ percentages: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 ... up to 100
~ example: 
 <div class="gc_50-p"></div>
set 50% width to the item
 

grido responsive

~ add 
gc_
class to your items, followed by the 
% width
that you're looking for and the device size + 
-p
if you want a the % value 
sm [mobile], md [tablet]
.
~ special widths: 
.gc_auto_{device}

~ breakpoints: md 
max-width: 991px;
sm 
max-width: 767px;

~ example: 
 <div class="gc_4 gc_6_md gc_12_sm"></div>
set 1/3 width for a desktop view, 1/2 for tablet and 100% for mobile;
 

grido pads

~ add 
grido--pads
class to the container to have padding between your items. otherwise you can add it in your own div with css
~ example: 
 <div class="grido grido--pads"></div>

grido alignments

space-between

~ [default alignment] items alignment to 
space-between
 
 
 

space-around

~ set 
grido--around
class to items for 
space-around
alignment
~ example: 
 <div class="grido grido--around"></div>
 
 
 

flex-start

~ set 
grido--start
class to items for 
flex-start
alignment
~ example: 
 <div class="grido grido--start"></div>
 
 
 

flex-end

~ set 
grido--end
class to items for 
flex-end
alignment
~ example: 
 <div class="grido grido--end"></div>
 
 
 

responsive alignments

~ set 
grido_{device}--{type}
to manage responsive alignments
~ example: 
 <div class="grido grido--start grido_md--end grido_sm--between"></div>
set 
flex-start
alignment for a desktop view, 
flex-end
for tablet and 
space-between
for mobile
 
 
 
 

grido autosizing and grow

~ set 
gc_auto
class to set auto fill of the all the window space
~ if you have a set of items and you want to have one element with a larger width you can set 
gc_auto_{number}
to set a 
flex-grow
to the item. the default is 1. 2 will be twice the other elements widths
~ it works responsive too with 
gc_auto_{number}__{device}

~ example: 
 <div class="grido gc_auto"></div><div class="grido gc_auto_3 gc_auto_1__md"></div>
 
 

grido order

~ set 
gc_order_
class to your items to change the order to display them
~ it works responsive too with 
gc_order_{number}__{device}
class
~ example: refers to block num 1 
 <div class="grido gc_auto gc_order_2 gc_order_1__md gc_order_3__sm"></div>
1
2
3

start to grido ... now

~ you can download the zipped file
~ you can install via npm 
npm install gridocss --save

~ you can fork it on github
by @giovannibieller
